    Extract Format Information From Export Program

    extract_fmt_info.Rmd
    library(qfmtchk)
library(dplyr)

    Disclaimer

    Tests and experiments in coming up with format files are described.

    SQL Program

    The SQL export program can be used as one possibel source of information. The following call produces a first table of columns and positions.

    s_sql_export_prg <- "/Users/pvr/Data/Projects/argus_sql/trunk/Argus/zws_gal_pgb.sql"
tbl_gal_fmt <- extract_gal_fmt(ps_sql_prg_path = s_sql_export_prg)
tbl_gal_fmt
#> # A tibble: 34 x 2
#>    ColName                   NrPos
#>    <chr>                     <int>
#>  1 rowTier.IDANIMAL             10
#>  2 rowTier.ANIDATENAISSANCE      3
#>  3 PA_ANI.nGetBlutanteilBS64     3
#>  4 rowGAL.IDVATER2              10
#>  5 dtGebDatETVater               3
#>  6 PA_ANI.nGetBlutanteilBS64     3
#>  7 rowGAL.IDVATER               10
#>  8 rowGAL.GEBDATVATER            3
#>  9 PA_ANI.nGetBlutanteilBS64     3
#> 10 rowGAL.LACNO                  2
#> # … with 24 more rows

    Improvements

    Based on the code some manual improvements have to be made. The following list shows all improvements.

    1. Row 3 contains the blood content of the animal
    tbl_gal_fmt$ColName[3] <- "BlutanteilAnimal"
    1. Rows 4-6 are a duplicate of rows 7-9
    tbl_gal_fmt <- tbl_gal_fmt %>% slice(-(4:6))
    1. Row 6 corresponds to the blood content of the sire
    tbl_gal_fmt$ColName[6] <- "BlutanteilVater"
    1. Row 9 corresponds to duration of pregancy
    tbl_gal_fmt$ColName[9] <- "Traechtigkeitsdauer"

    The above steps can also be done with the following function call

    tbl_gal_fmt <- improve_fmt(ptbl_fmt = tbl_gal_fmt,
                           pvec_del_row_idx = 4:6,
                           ptbl_col_rename = tibble::tibble(RowIndex = c(3,6,9),
                                                            NewName=c("BlutanteilAnimal",
                                                                      "BlutanteilVater",
                                                                      "Traechtigkeitsdauer")))

    Cumulative Position

    tbl_gal_fmt_ext <- tbl_gal_fmt %>% bind_cols(CumNrPos = cumsum(tbl_gal_fmt$NrPos))

    Check

    knitr::kable(tbl_gal_fmt_ext)
    ColName NrPos CumNrPos
    rowTier.IDANIMAL 10 10
    rowTier.ANIDATENAISSANCE 3 13
    BlutanteilAnimal 3 16

    Output

    Write an output-fmt file.

    s_gal_fmt_file <- "gal_check.fmt"
if (file.exists(s_gal_fmt_file)) unlink(s_gal_fmt_file)
n_nr_fmt_rec <- nrow(tbl_gal_fmt_ext)
# start with first line outside of loop
cat("# ", tbl_gal_fmt_ext$ColName[1], "\n", sep = "", file = s_gal_fmt_file, append = TRUE)
cat("[1-", tbl_gal_fmt_ext$CumNrPos[1], "]\n", sep = "", file = s_gal_fmt_file, append = TRUE)
cat("data_required=True \n\n", sep = "", file = s_gal_fmt_file, append = TRUE)
if (n_nr_fmt_rec > 1){
  for (idx in 2:n_nr_fmt_rec){
    cat("# ", tbl_gal_fmt_ext$ColName[idx], "\n", sep = "", file = s_gal_fmt_file, append = TRUE)
    cat("[", tbl_gal_fmt_ext$CumNrPos[idx-1]+1, "-", tbl_gal_fmt_ext$CumNrPos[idx], "]\n", sep = "", file = s_gal_fmt_file, append = TRUE)
    cat("data_required=True \n\n", sep = "", file = s_gal_fmt_file, append = TRUE)
  }

}

    The same output can be produced by the following function call.

    output_fmt(ps_fmt_outfile = s_gal_fmt_file, ptbl_fmt = tbl_gal_fmt)
#>  * FOUND output FMT File:  gal_check.fmt  ==> delete it ...

    The first few lines of the produced file is

    cat(head(readLines(s_gal_fmt_file), n=10L), sep = "\n")
#> # rowTier.IDANIMAL
#> [1-10]
#> data_required=True 
#> 
#> # rowTier.ANIDATENAISSANCE
#> [11-13]
#> data_required=True 
#> 
#> # BlutanteilAnimal
#> [14-16]
